Welcome

Here are the resources I've found that help in a general sense. These are the things that cover a broad range of topics.

Mozilla Developer Network

Visit

Perhaps the single most important resource on the web is the Mozilla Developer Network. This single resource has just about everything you will need to fully understand HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The website is incredibly extensive, reliable, and up-to-date. If you're looking for array methods, or CSS properties, or anything else, you will find it here.

Stack Overflow

Visit

You got questions? We've got answers. Stack Overflow is the premier forum for programmers of all stripes. It doesn't matter if your question is about CSS, C# or Swift, Stack Overflow has a place for everyone. The website is well moderated and highly recommended by everyone. It is my go-to whenever I have a question, and usually I find my answer. If not, I post it and get an answer within a few hours, if not sooner.

While you're there, check out Stack Exchange, for communities about a wide range of subjects from cooking to world history.

Team Treehouse

Visit

Treehouse is a fantastic resource for learning web development and programming. They have courses on everything. Their web development courses cover the full stack, starting at basic web development and including server-side technologies like Node.js and Django, or frameworks like React. They also include courses for app development with both Android and iOS, where you can learn Java and Swift. The only downside is the $20.00 monthly fee.

freeCodeCamp

Visit

freeCodeCamp is an excellent resource to get you started. Right off the bat, they take you through the basics of the Holy Trinity. They provide you with JavaScript challenges and web projects to help you build out your portfolio along the way. There's a forum of people waiting to help you as well

Also be sure to check out their Medium pages and their Youtube channel as well.
